title: The Apothecary's Back Room
description: An anonymous tip claims that Grey Apothecary proprietor Blex is selling unlicensed medicines out of her back room — treatments not cleared by the Medical Quarter and allegedly containing Void-adjacent compounds. Director Sela wants a discreet investigation before making any official move.

turns.narrative: The Grey Apothecary front shop is entirely normal — licensed herbs, standard pain relief, cleaning compounds. Blex is professional and careful. But you notice customers occasionally saying a specific phrase at the counter that causes Blex to pause before serving them.
turns.choice_a: Observe the counter phrase pattern and attempt to replicate it
turns.consequence_a: After careful listening you identify the phrase: 'I need the strong sort.' Using it earns you a measured look and an invitation to the back room.
turns.choice_b: Approach Blex openly as a Med Quarter health inspector
turns.consequence_b: Blex is immediately guarded and professional. No back room mention. She has done this before.

turns.narrative: In the back room you find a range of unlicensed treatments — including one for chronic pain derived from Void-mushroom extract. The treatments appear to be helping people with conditions the licensed Medical Quarter cannot adequately treat.
turns.choice_a: Report Blex to Director Sela with a full account — including evidence that patients are benefiting
turns.consequence_a: Sela is conflicted. She issues a warning rather than an arrest and begins a fast-track evaluation of Blex's formulas.
turns.choice_b: Give Blex a week to self-report to the Medical Quarter for a voluntary licensing review
turns.consequence_b: Blex, to her credit, appears the next morning and submits everything voluntarily. The review is fair and detailed.

turns.narrative: Three of Blex's formulas pass the licensing review. Two do not.
turns.choice_a: Help Blex reformat the failed formulas to remove the problematic Void compound
turns.consequence_a: With Alchemist Rynn's help, two of the formulas are reformulated without Void components and re-submitted.
turns.choice_b: Document the failed formulas for academic research to improve future treatment options
turns.consequence_b: Two formulas are transferred to the Academic Quarter for continued development under controlled conditions.

formulas_licensed.description: Three Blex formulas licensed. Two reformulated and re-submitted.

research_transferred.description: Failed formulas transferred to Academic Quarter for development.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Three Blex formulas licensed. Two reformulated and re-submitted.
